heisig_chinese_memo: An amazing detective solves the case of the two blades and two footprints by recognizing the source of the astringent (acidic / bitter) taste of the water on the blades.
Ru_trainchinese: sè: (прил) (о вкусе) вяжущий, терпкий; (о стиле письма) сложный, тяжелый; негладкий, шероховатый
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A lemon is too astringent (sour/bitter) to eat straight up.  Wash it with water, peel it with a blade, but stop before you put it in your  mouth.  Just use it for cooking.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " water " and "歰", the original meaning is not smooth. "Zhengzitong‧ Zhibu": "Oh, don't make it astringent." "Shuwen": "Oh, it's not slippery. From four stops." Tang Wangjian "Dangchuangzhi": "Shuihan hand is astringent and silky, Keep getting bad-hearted."

" Astringency " can mean unsatisfactory taste, like alum or unripe persimmon, which makes the tongue feel numb and dry. Tang Li Xian used "Introduction to the Village Wall by Wu Chushi": "Autumn fruit, hawthorn and pears are astringent, and bamboo shoots and ferns are fresh in the morning."

" Astringent " also means that the road is dangerous; not smooth. Jin Penny "Welcoming Dajia": "The sophistication has not yet been smashed, and the letter has become ill."

" Astringent " also refers to slow, difficult, blunt, and erratic speaking and writing. Tang Yaohe "Spring Festival Evening Rain in the Rain": "The inglorus speaks a little bit in the wind, it is difficult to fly with the rain and butterflies.

" Astringent " also refers to rust. Tang Liu Changqing "Ancient Sword": "The iron clothes are now astringent, and the precious blade can still be tried."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " water " and "歰", the original meaning is not smooth.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「歰」聲，本義為不光滑。《正字通‧止部》：「歰，別作澀。」《說文》：「歰，不滑也。从四止。」 唐王建〈當窗織〉：「水寒手澀絲脆斷，續來續去心腸爛。」

　　「澀」可表示味不甘滑，像明礬或不熟的柿子那樣使舌頭感到麻木乾燥的味道。唐李咸用〈和吳處士題村叟壁〉：「秋果樝梨澀，晨羞筍蕨鮮。」

　　「澀」也表示道路險阻；不通暢。晉潘尼〈迎大駕〉：「世故尚未夷，崤函方嶮澀。」

　　「澀」也指說話、寫文章遲鈍、艱難、生硬，不流暢。唐姚合〈春晚雨中〉：「迎風鶯語澀，帶雨蝶飛難。」

　　「澀」還指生銹。唐劉長卿〈古劍〉：「鐵衣今正澀，寶刃猶可試。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「歰」聲，本義為不光滑。

①不光滑，不滑溜：輪軸發澀。
②一種使舌頭感到不滑潤不好受的滋味：苦澀。這個柿子很澀。
③文字難讀難懂，不流暢：晦澀。生澀。澀訥。

Chinese: An amazing detective solves the case of the two blades and two footprints by recognizing the source of the astringent (acidic / bitter) taste of the water on the blades.
Meaning: astringent
Hanzi: 涩
Story: A lemon is too astringent (sour/bitter) to eat straight up. Wash it with water, peel it with a blade, but stop before you put it in your mouth. Just use it for cooking.
Kind: traditional
從「 水 」，「 歰 」聲，本義為不光滑。《正字通‧止部》：「歰，別作澀。」《說文》：「歰，不滑也。从四止。」 唐王建〈當窗織〉：「水寒手澀絲脆斷，續來續去心腸爛。」 「 澀 」可表示味不甘滑，像明礬或不熟的柿子那樣使舌頭感到麻木乾燥的味道。唐李咸用〈和吳處士題村叟壁〉：「秋果樝梨澀，晨羞筍蕨鮮。」 「 澀 」也表示道路險阻；不通暢。晉潘尼〈迎大駕〉：「世故尚未夷，崤函方嶮澀。」 「 澀 」也指說話、寫文章遲鈍、艱難、生硬，不流暢。唐姚合〈春晚雨中〉：「迎風鶯語澀，帶雨蝶飛難。」 「 澀 」還指生銹。唐劉長卿〈古劍〉：「鐵衣今正澀，寶刃猶可試。」
From the sound of " water" and " 歰", the original meaning is not smooth. "Zhengzitong‧ Zhibu": "Oh, don't make it astringent." "Shuwen": "Oh, it's not slippery. From four stops." Tang Wangjian "Dangchuangzhi": "Shuihan hand is astringent and silky, Keep getting bad-hearted." " Astringency" can mean unsatisfactory taste, like alum or unripe persimmon, which makes the tongue feel numb and dry. Tang Li Xian used "Introduction to the Village Wall by Wu Chushi": "Autumn fruit, hawthorn and pears are astringent, and bamboo shoots and ferns are fresh in the morning." " Astringent" also means that the road is dangerous; not smooth. Jin Penny "Welcoming Dajia": "The sophistication has not yet been smashed, and the letter has become ill." " Astringent" also refers to slow, difficult, blunt, and erratic speaking and writing. Tang Yaohe "Spring Festival Evening Rain in the Rain": "The inglorus speaks a little bit in the wind, it is difficult to fly with the rain and butterflies. " Astringent" also refers to rust. Tang Liu Changqing "Ancient Sword": "The iron clothes are now astringent, and the precious blade can still be tried."

澀字的基本解释

澀
sè
见“涩”。

澀字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sè］
［《廣韻》色立切，入緝，生。］
亦作“歮1”。亦作“澁1”。亦作“濇1”。亦作“瀒1”。“泣3”的被通假字。“涩1”的繁体字。
(1)不光滑；不灵活；不滑润。
(2)味不甘滑，像明矾或不熟的杮子那样使舌头感到麻木干燥的味道。
(3)说话、写文章迟钝、艰难、生硬，不流畅。
(4)道路险阻；不通畅。
(5)生锈。
(6)急。

澀字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　澀； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页651第20
【唐韻】【韻會】色立切【集韻】【正韻】色入切，?音濇。與歰同。【說文】不滑也。【風俗通·十反篇】冷澀比干寒蜒。　又牆叠石作水文爲澀浪。【溫庭筠詩】澀浪浮瓊砌。　又竹名。【范成大·桂海草木志】澀竹，膚麤澀如砂紙。【集韻】或作瀒?澁。?字原作刃下止。

澀字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
澀字的起名意思

暂无。

astringent
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [sè]
["Guangyun" is a sharp cut, seized, and born. ]
Also known as "歮1". Also known as "澁1". Also known as "Yi 1". Also known as "Yuan 1". "Cry 3" was passed falsely. Traditional characters for "Sute 1".
(1) Not smooth; not flexible; not slippery.
(2) The taste is unsatisfactory and makes the tongue feel numb and dry like alum or unripe burrito.
(3) Speaking and writing articles are slow, difficult, blunt, and not fluent.
(4) The road is dangerous; it is not clear.
(5) Rust.
(6) Urgent.
astringent
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Siji 1] [Water Word Department] 　 Shibu; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 651 No. 20
[Tang Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Se Liqie [Ji Yun] [Zheng Rhyme] Sekiness,? Yin Yi. Same as Xiao. [Said Wen] It's not slippery. 【Tongsu Tong·Ten Fans】Cold and astringent than dry and cold.　The hydrology on the wall and stacking stones is astringent waves. 【Wen Tingyun's poems】The astringent waves and floating Qiong build.　Also named bamboo. [Fan Chengda·Guihai Grass and Wood Records] Astringent bamboo, skin rough and astringent like sandpaper. [Jiyun] Or Zuoying? 澁. ? The original word ends at the bottom of the blade.
